meanings.definition: The characteristic sound made by a horse, especially when excited or nervous.
meanings.sent1: The whinny of the horse could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: I love the gentle whinny of my horse when I visit him in the barn.
meanings.sent3: The whinny of the horse startled the little girl, making her giggle.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the whinny of the horse echoed through the quiet valley.
meanings.sent5: The whinny of the horse was a comforting sound to the lonely traveler.

meanings.definition: To make the characteristic sound of a horse, especially when excited or nervous.
meanings.sent1: The horse began to whinny loudly as the storm approached.
meanings.sent2: I could hear my horse whinnying in the pasture as I walked towards him.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy tried to whinny like a horse, much to his friends' amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to whinny through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to whinny through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
